channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Child abuse investigations: Met Police warned it could be putting children in danger
item.description: The force does not identify at-risk children quickly enough in its investigations, a report finds.

item.title: Hartlepool journalist killed in Ghana robbery
item.description: The 31-year-old from Hartlepool was making a documentary in Africa for a Muslim television network.

item.title: Brent petrol murder: Man guilty of killing wife in arson attack
item.description: Damion Simmons doused Denise Keane-Simmons in petrol then set her on fire inside her home.

item.title: Humpback whale breaches off Isles of Scilly
item.description: The humpback whale is thought to have been attracted to the area by large shoals of sardines.

item.title: Childcare costs: London parents call for review
item.description: Childcare costs are 30% higher in inner London than the national average, a study found.

item.title: Tour de Yorkshire 2022 cancelled
item.description: The race organisers say the 2022 event would be unviable due to "escalating financial challenges".

item.title: Manchester ovarian cancer survivor pushes for more research
item.description: A woman who has recovered from a rare form of ovarian cancer is campaigning for further research into the disease.

item.title: Cambridge University college master resigns over handling of sex complaints
item.description: An inquiry recommends a college takes disciplinary action against its master Dr Jeremy Morris.

item.title: Pictures show devastation caused by Leamington Spa plastics fire
item.description: Emergency services said they have still been unable to enter the site to search for a missing man.

item.title: Family of ducks waddles through University of Nottingham library
item.description: The mother and her ducklings were "calm and unflustered" as they walked around George Green Library.

item.title: Drummer, 11, plays with Foo Fighters at LA gig
item.description: Nandi Bushell joins the American rock band on stage in Los Angeles.

item.title: Feminist Collages London: Tackling violence against women with slogan posters
item.description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

item.title: Why teenagers are mentoring senior Met Police officers
item.description: Three teenagers have mentored a trio of the Met’s top women officers over the last six months.

item.title: Decades of hoarding made house 'a no-go area'
item.description: A woman who struggled with buying and hoarding "bargains" for 30 years explains how it began.

item.title: Afghanistan events 'raw and emotional' for veterans
item.description: Military veteran Nick Wilson says the current Afghanistan crisis is affecting those who fought there.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Gordon Reid and Alfie Hewett reach semi-finals as GB win two more bronzes
item.description: Gordon Reid and Alfie Hewett reach the men's singles semi-finals at the Tokyo Paralympics while Great Britain win two more bronzes.

item.title: Harry Kane: England captain has 'clear conscience' after Manchester City transfer saga
item.description: England captain Harry Kane says he has a "clear conscience" after a potential move to Manchester City from Tottenham Hotspur failed to materialise.

item.title: US Open 2021: Emma Raducanu wins on New York main-draw debut
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu again shows her talent and maturity on the Grand Slam stage as she eases to victory on her US Open main-draw debut.

item.title: Transfer deadline day: Premier League spending tops £1bn but is down on previous year
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo's move back to Manchester United on transfer deadline day helps to push Premier League clubs' spending past £1bn - but overall outlay has dropped.

item.title: Arsenal 3-0 Slavia Prague: Nikita Parris scores early opener in victory
item.description: Nikita Parris scores 94 seconds into her home debut as Arsenal beat Slavia Prague 3-0 in the first leg of their Champions League qualifier.
